content.prompt: Which of the following is true of most federal judges appointed by the president?

choices.label: They serve as long as the appointing president stays in power.
They serve for life on good behavior unless removed by the president.
They serve for life on good behavior unless impeached and convicted by Congress.
They serve for life and are not subject to congressional impeachment.

topic.text: 2.9: The Role of the Judicial Branch
